free_text.Content: The course may contain, but not exclusively, the following elements : [br/][][br/][br/][b]Mechanics[/b][br/][b]Dynamics of a system of point masses and solides[/b][br/]Center of mass, angular momentum, energy, rigid body, gyroscopic effects.[br/][b]Change of reference frame[/b][br/]Galiliean invariance, dynamics in non-inertial reference frames.[br/][b]Special relativity[/b][br/]Lorentz transformations, relativistic momentum and energy.[br/][b]Supplementary material[/b][br/]Analytical mechanics[br/][][br/][b]Thermodynamics[/b] [br/][b]Equilibrium[/b][br/]Pressure, temperature, internal energy.[br/][b]Energy exchanges[/b][br/]Work and heat. First principle.[br/][b]Entropy[/b][br/]Second principle. Cycles,(Carnot). Efficiency.[br/][b]Supplementary material according to sections[/b][br/]Thermodynamic potentials, statistical interpretation of the 2nd principle, irreversible processes, heat conduction, bodily diffusion, phase transitions.[br/][br/]
